intro: Thesium brachystylum, commonly known as the short-stemmed thesium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive, often showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, arranged in dense clusters, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Thesium brachystylum is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
